description.value:
A functional status problem observation is a clinical statement that represents a patient's functional perfomance and ability.
THIS TEMPLATE HAS BEEN DEPRECATED IN C-CDA R2 AND MAY BE DELETED FROM A FUTURE RELEASE OF THIS IMPLEMENTATION GUIDE. USE OF THIS TEMPLATE IS NOT RECOMMENDED.
*Reason for deprecation*: Functional Status Problem Observation has been merged, without loss of expressivity, into Functional Status Observation (2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.4.67:2014-06-09).

requirements.value: SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode="OBS" (CodeSystem: HL7ActClass urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.5.6 STATIC) (CONF:1098-14282).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode="EVN" Event (CodeSystem: HL7ActMood urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.5.1001 STATIC) (CONF:1098-14283).

short.value: Use negationInd="true" to indicate that the problem was not observed.

requirements.value: MAY contain zero or one [0..1] @negationInd (CONF:1098-14307).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] templateId (CONF:1098-14312) such that it
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @extension="2014-06-09" (CONF:1098-32601).
SHALL contain at least one [1..*] id (CONF:1098-14284).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code (CONF:1098-14314).
This code SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] @code="248536006" finding of functional performance and activity (CodeSystem: SNOMED CT urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.6.96 STATIC) (CONF:1098-14315).
SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] text (CONF:1098-14304).
The text, if present, SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] reference (CONF:1098-15552).
The reference, if present, SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] @value (CONF:1098-15553).

human.value: This reference/@value SHALL begin with a '#' and SHALL point to its corresponding narrative (using the approach defined in CDA Release 2, section 4.3.5.1) (CONF:1098-15554).

requirements.value: SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] statusCode (CONF:1098-14286).
This statusCode SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @code="completed" Completed (CodeSystem: HL7ActStatus urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.5.14 STATIC) (CONF:1098-19100).
SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] effectiveTime (CONF:1098-14287).

short.value: The value of effectiveTime/low represents onset date.

requirements.value: The effectiveTime, if present, SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] low (CONF:1098-26456).

short.value: If the problem is resolved, record the resolution date in effectiveTime/high. If the problem is known to be resolved but the resolution date is not known, use @nullFlavor="UNK". If the problem is not resolved, do not include the high element.

requirements.value: The effectiveTime, if present, MAY contain zero or one [0..1] high (CONF:1098-26457).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] value with @xsi:type="CD", where the code SHOULD be selected from ValueSet Problem urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.3.88.12.3221.7.4 DYNAMIC (CONF:1098-14291).
This value MAY contain zero or one [0..1] @nullFlavor (CONF:1098-14292).

human.value: If the diagnosis is unknown or the SNOMED code is unknown, @nullFlavor SHOULD be “UNK”. If the diagnosis is known but the code cannot be found in the Value Set, @nullFlavor SHOULD be “OTH” and the known diagnosis code SHOULD be placed in the translation element (CONF:1098-14293).

requirements.value: MAY contain zero or one [0..1] methodCode (CONF:1098-14316).
